metadata.title: Wihngo - A love-centric community for people who care about birds
metadata.description: Wihngo is a love-centric community for people who care about birds. A place where bird stories are shared, connections are formed, and support is given with care.
metadata.twitterDescription: A love-centric community platform for bird lovers.

footer.tagline: A love-centric community for people who care about birds.
footer.copyright: Wihngo. Built with love for birds and their humans.

home.heroDescription: Wihngo is a love-centric community for people who care about birds. It's a place where bird stories are shared, connections are formed, and support is given with care.
home.mobileAppCta: The full Wihngo experience lives in the mobile app.
home.birdStoriesSubtitle: Every bird has a story. Every moment matters.

stories.pageDescription: Every bird has a story. Every moment matters. Here are some of the beautiful journeys shared by our community.
stories.haveStoryDescription: Download the Wihngo app to share your bird's special moments with a community that truly understands and celebrates them.
stories.metaDescription: Read heartwarming stories from bird lovers around the world. Every chirp, every moment, shared with love.

storyDetail.supportDescription: Download the Wihngo app to connect with {name} and their human, read more stories, and optionally provide support when needed.

bird.communitySince: Part of the Wihngo community since {date}

bird.connectDescription: Download the Wihngo app to follow {name}'s journey, read new stories as they're shared, and optionally provide support when needed.

faq.pageDescription: Everything you need to know about Wihngo, our values, and how we operate.
faq.generalDescription: Learn the basics about Wihngo and what makes us different
faq.supportDescription: How financial support works on Wihngo
faq.transparencyDescription: Our commitment to openness and honesty
faq.stillHaveQuestionsDescription: We believe in complete transparency. If you have questions that aren't answered here, we'd love to hear from you. Download the app to connect with our community and team.
faq.metaDescription: Learn more about Wihngo, how it works, and our commitment to birds and their humans.

faqItems.a1: Wihngo is a love-centric community platform for bird lovers. It's a place where people who care deeply about their feathered companions can share stories, connect with others, and celebrate the joy that birds bring to our lives. Wihngo is built on the belief that our relationships with birds are about love, care, and companionship - not commodification.
faqItems.a2: No. Wihngo is fundamentally about love for birds and the people who care for them. While the platform includes optional ways to support birds in need, this is never required or pushed. We believe that genuine care and community come first, always. Wihngo exists to celebrate and strengthen the bond between humans and birds, not to profit from it.
faqItems.q3: How does financial support work on Wihngo?
faqItems.a3: The Wihngo mobile app allows community members to voluntarily support birds who need help with veterinary care, food, or other necessities. All support is optional and transparent. We provide clear information about where contributions go, and we never pressure anyone to give. The focus is always on the bird's wellbeing and the human's genuine desire to help.
faqItems.q4: What happens if a bird passes away?
faqItems.a4: The loss of a bird is deeply painful, and Wihngo treats this with the utmost respect and sensitivity. If financial support was provided for a bird who has passed, we handle each situation individually and with care. Transparency is paramount - we communicate openly with supporters and, when appropriate, redirect contributions to other birds in need, always with consent. Our priority is honoring the bird's memory and supporting their human through grief.
faqItems.a5: Complete transparency is a core value of Wihngo. We openly share how the platform operates, how financial support is handled, and the principles that guide our decisions. We believe trust is earned through honesty, and we're committed to being clear about every aspect of how Wihngo functions. If you have questions, we have answers.
faqItems.q6: Can I share my bird's story on Wihngo?
faqItems.a6: Yes! The Wihngo mobile app (available on Android and iOS) allows you to share your bird's stories, photos, and special moments with the community. Whether your bird learned a new trick, had a funny moment, or you simply want to celebrate their presence in your life, Wihngo is the place to share it. Note: This public website is read-only; posting requires the mobile app.
faqItems.a7: Yes, Wihngo is free to download and use. You can share stories, connect with other bird lovers, and participate in the community without any cost. Optional financial support features exist for those who wish to help birds in need, but using Wihngo itself is completely free.
faqItems.q8: What makes Wihngo different from other platforms?
faqItems.a8: Wihngo is built on love, not algorithms designed to maximize engagement or profit. We don't exploit emotional content for clicks or ad revenue. We don't treat birds as products. Instead, we focus on genuine connection, meaningful stories, and building a supportive community. Wihngo exists because birds deserve better, and so do the people who love them.
faqItems.q9: How can I connect with other bird lovers?
faqItems.a9: The Wihngo mobile app provides features for connecting with other members of the community. You can read and react to stories, follow birds and their humans, and participate in a community that truly understands the unique joy and responsibility of caring for birds. This public website shows you a preview of the community, but full interaction happens in the app.
faqItems.a10: Wihngo is built with care, intention, and respect for both birds and humans. We use modern technology to create a smooth, accessible experience, but technology always serves the mission - never the other way around. The mobile app is available on Android and iOS, and this website provides public access to stories and information about the Wihngo community.

privacy.intro: Wihngo respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data.
privacy.whoWeAreContent: Wihngo is a platform operated in the European Union. The company is in the process of registration in Estonia.
privacy.whatDataIntro: When you visit wihngo.com, we may collect:
privacy.whatDataItem1: Basic technical data (such as IP address, browser type, device information)
privacy.whatDataItem2: Anonymous usage data for website performance and analytics
privacy.whatDataNote: The website is read-only. No accounts, payments, or interactions are performed on the website.
privacy.legalBasisContent: Data is processed under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) based on legitimate interest.
privacy.dataSharingContent: We do not sell your data. Some data may be processed by trusted service providers (such as analytics or hosting services).
privacy.dataRetentionContent: Data is kept only as long as necessary for the purposes described above.
privacy.yourRightsContent: You have the right to access, correct, or request deletion of your personal data.
privacy.metaDescription: Wihngo respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data.

terms.intro: By accessing wihngo.com, you agree to the following terms.
terms.platformRoleContent: Wihngo is a community platform. It is not a charity, financial institution, or veterinary service.
terms.websiteUsageContent: The website is provided for informational purposes only. The main Wihngo services are delivered through mobile applications.
terms.userContentContent: Content shown on the website originates from users of the Wihngo platform. Users remain the owners of their content.
terms.noGuaranteesContent: Wihngo does not guarantee outcomes related to birds, stories, or support activities.
terms.limitationContent: Wihngo is not responsible for any loss or damage arising from the use of the website.
terms.governingLawContent: These terms are governed by the laws of Estonia and the European Union.
terms.metaDescription: Terms of Service for Wihngo platform.

donation.title: Support the Future of Bird Care
donation.description: You can support Wihngo by donating USDC or SOL on the Solana network. Please make sure you are sending on Solana, not Ethereum or any other network.
donation.currentSupportTitle: What You Are Supporting Right Now
donation.currentSupportIntro: Wihngo is currently in its early stage.
donation.currentSupportExplanation: At this phase, donations are not yet used directly to feed or care for birds. Instead, your support helps fund the development of the Wihngo platform — the foundation needed to support birds in a sustainable and transparent way.
donation.currentSupportItem1: Build and improve the Wihngo platform
donation.currentSupportItem2: Develop tools for organizing and tracking bird care initiatives
donation.currentSupportItem3: Create a system that can support birds at scale in the future
donation.currentSupportConclusion: By supporting Wihngo today, you are helping build the infrastructure that will allow real, long-term care for birds tomorrow.
donation.warning: Sending funds on the wrong network may result in permanent loss. Please double-check that you are using the Solana network.
donation.helpMessage: Every donation helps provide food and care for birds.

whyBirdsMatter.pageDescription: Understanding the vulnerability of birds and why they deserve our care and attention.
whyBirdsMatter.metaDescription: Learn why caring for birds matters and how you can make a difference in their lives.
whyBirdsMatter.heroSubtitle: They depend on us more than we realize
whyBirdsMatter.section1Content: Those who raise birds at home know how vulnerable they are. Their only resource is the food we provide; they cannot earn a living or find food on their own. When you put out food for them, birds try to hold onto it as if it were a treasure.
whyBirdsMatter.section2Content: I once saw a fattened hen, after eating, sit next to the dish, clutching it with her wing as if afraid someone would take it from her. Some birds sit on top of their food, and some even tread on it with their feet. Birds do not have hands like we do; they simply peck with their beaks to eat or chirp to ask for something.
whyBirdsMatter.section3Content: Raising broiler chickens taught me about their needs. They are among the weakest creatures; they love clean water and cleanliness. Unfortunately, they are often neglected, especially regarding hygiene. They are kept in dirty places, and while they suffer, they cannot do anything about it.
whyBirdsMatter.section4Content: When a hen needs to relieve herself, she must do it right there, and all she can do is move to another spot. If there is no space, she is forced to sit on the waste and get dirty, which is torture for her. These creatures deserve better.
whyBirdsMatter.section5Content: This initiative aims to encourage people to care for and nurture birds, including cleaning them and feeding them their favorite food. We want birds to stay healthy and feel loved.

supportPage.pageDescription: Your support helps provide food, care, and love to birds in need.
supportPage.metaDescription: Help us care for vulnerable birds. Every contribution makes a difference.
supportPage.heroSubtitle: A small gesture from you means the world to them
supportPage.emotionalParagraph1: Birds cannot speak for themselves. They cannot earn a living or seek help on their own. Their only resource is the care we choose to give them. When a bird clutches food with her wing, afraid it might be taken away, you realize how precious even the smallest gift of care can be.
supportPage.emotionalParagraph2: Every bird deserves clean water, proper food, and a clean space to live. Many are kept in conditions that cause them suffering, unable to change their situation. With your support, we can change that story for more birds.
supportPage.emotionalParagraph3: A small amount may not mean much to you, but it brings happiness to these creatures. Your contribution helps provide food, veterinary care, and the love that every bird deserves.
supportPage.thankYouNote: Every contribution, no matter how small, makes a real difference.
supportPage.clarificationChickens: I described the suffering of chickens to highlight their reality, hoping people will treat them better.
supportPage.clarificationNotCharity: Wihngo is not a charity and is not responsible for all birds worldwide.
supportPage.clarificationCommunity: Wihngo is a community for bird lovers to share moments of love and care with their birds. If you have a bird you love and care for, you can share these moments on Wihngo.
supportPage.clarificationDiscover: Instead of searching YouTube for a duck video, you can find it on Wihngo, follow it, and see any new updates. You also have the option to support the bird, so the owner can buy something for the bird, such as its favorite food or other items.
supportPage.clarificationBusiness: Wihngo is a for-profit business and charges a 5% fee on every transaction made on the platform.
supportPage.clarificationConclusion: We may not be able to help every bird in the world, but we can bring happiness to the birds in our care – and we hope that kindness extends to every living creature.

aboutPage.pageDescription: A love-centric community dedicated to the wellbeing of birds and the people who care for them.
aboutPage.metaDescription: Learn about Wihngo's mission to create a loving community for birds and their humans.
aboutPage.heroSubtitle: Built with love for birds and their humans
aboutPage.missionContent: Wihngo is a love-centric community for people who care about birds. We encourage people to care for and nurture birds, providing them with proper food, clean environments, and the love they deserve. We believe that every bird matters and that the bond between humans and birds is precious.
aboutPage.value1Content: Everything we do is driven by genuine love for birds and the people who care for them.
aboutPage.value2Content: We believe in complete openness about how we operate and how support reaches the birds.
aboutPage.value3Content: We bring together bird lovers to share stories, support each other, and celebrate the joy birds bring.
aboutPage.value4Content: We promote proper care practices including nutrition, hygiene, and health for all birds.
aboutPage.visionContent: We envision a world where every bird is treated with dignity, lives in a clean environment, enjoys proper nutrition, and feels loved.

blogStory.pageDescription: Understanding the vulnerability of birds through firsthand experience.
blogStory.metaTitle: A Story of Care | Wihngo Blog
blogStory.metaDescription: A heartfelt story about the vulnerability of birds and why they deserve our care.
blogStory.title: What Birds Taught Me About Care
blogStory.subtitle: A personal reflection on the vulnerability and beauty of our feathered friends
blogStory.author: Wihngo Community
blogStory.paragraph1: Those who raise birds at home, such as chickens and ducks, know how vulnerable they are. Their only resource is the food provided to them; they cannot earn a living or find food on their own. When you put out food for them, the birds try to hold onto it as if it were a treasure.
blogStory.paragraph2: I saw a fattened hen, after eating, sit next to the dish, clutching it with her wing as if she were afraid someone would take it from her. Some birds sit on top of the food, and some even tread on it with their feet. Birds do not have hands like we do; they simply peck with their beaks to eat or chirp to ask for something.
blogStory.paragraph3: A small amount of money may not mean much to you, but it brings happiness to these creatures.
blogStory.paragraph4: If you have birds, buy food for them, look for their favorite food, and feed them. If you do not have birds, you can bring some into your home. I had an experience with broiler chicken. Raising it was a difficult task, as it needs a lot of care.
blogStory.paragraph5: Broiler chickens are among the weakest creatures; they love to drink clean water and to be clean. Unfortunately, they are often neglected, especially regarding cleanliness. They are kept in dirty places, and the chickens suffer but cannot do anything about it.
blogStory.paragraph6: When a hen needs to relieve herself, she must do it right there, and all she can do is move to another spot. If there is no space, she is forced to sit on the excrement and get dirty, which is torture for her.
blogStory.paragraph7: This initiative aims to encourage people to care for and nurture birds, including cleaning them and feeding them their favorite food. We want birds to stay healthy and feel loved.
